page.title: 06The Windmill Trust Society.
page.content: A local place of interest is the Waltham Windmill.Visitors to the area are able to see how the Waltham Windmill Trust Society have tried to restore the mill to working order.The Society hold Open Days when the public are able to watch the mill being worked by Mr.Wilson,the miller. They have maintained the four sets of stones,two Derbyshire grit stones which grind oats and cattle feed,and the two French Burr stones which grind the flour.The mill can now be worked by wind and engine power. The Trust Society has spent over thirty thousand pounds since 1979.The money has been spent on painting and tarring the mill.By late August or early September of this year four sails will have been replaced which will restore it to the original six sailed mill.
